page.title: 14ST.James's Church
page.content: The building of St.James began in 1350 and was completed 90 years later. The spire was added to the church by 1515,it was built by 80 masons working for 5d a day.The tower is 290 feet high and has 130 steps leading to the spire.From here on a clear day you can see for about 13 miles in any direction.The church is built from limestone from Stratford upon Avon.None of the stained glass windows are original,having been replaced in the last hundred years.The eight bells in the tower weigh in at ten tonnes.To date there have been 45 vicars at St. James.The current vicar Reverand Owen has been there for 6 years and gets about 160 people in his congregation on a Sunday.
